title: Sunil Chhetri Apologises To Fans After Frustrating Draw Against Bangladesh
text:
In what was always going to be a massive game in their World Cup qualifying round, India failed to beat Bangladesh in their third game of the campaign.

AFP

After a hugely deserving and historic draw against Asian Champions Qatar, India came into the game knowing a win would give them a more than decent chance of finishing in the top two of their group and would have given their hopes a massive lift on road to the 2022 World Cup.

It wasn't to be as a spirited Bangladesh team lead 1-0 till the very end until Adil Khan equalised in the 88th minute. The game would end in a stalemate and leave India fourth in the group with two points.

Indian captain Sunil Chhetri was rightly and visibly disappointed as he rued his side's missed chances and was clearly let unhappy with team's inability to score.

He took to Twitter to share his disappointment:

We couldn't deliver a performance to match the atmosphere at the Salt Lake last night, and the dressing room is very disappointed about it. We couldn’t capitalise on the chances we got,but this is a process on the pitch and in the stands. You turned up, we'll keep attempting to. — Sunil Chhetri (@chetrisunil11) October 16, 2019

It was a laboured display by India in front of the goal and it has left them with all to do in the group.

The defensive fatalities also showed when the home sided conceded in the 42nd minute when Saad Uddin gave Bangladesh the lead and for long periods it looked like it will be the winning goal.

But India had a saviour in Adil Khan who pounced with a brilliant header to help India save their blushes.
